text:
Some more thoughts.

> Alan spent most of the lunch intellectually destroying me, smacking me around, and pointing out how much more I have to learn
Alan is the 'CS research gadfly', perhaps. Like how Socrates was the social gadfly "to sting people and whip them into a fury, all in the service of truth." - Plato on Socrates in his defense.
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_gadfly>

Regarding goals, this reminded me of the philosophical question "Is there true altruism?"

Compare
> Research is all about progress.. No ego
and
> Alan helped show me that I am professing to be benevolent when I really just wanted to get all the credit for “democratizing programming.”
vs.
> It seemed like Alan was asking me to pick: how benevolent do you actually want to be?

Is there no ego in the last one?
